_comment: Created by rreed on 4/19/2017 4:37:27 PM using v2.7
title: How does nurse density per population compare internationally and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary:
For the majority of countries reviewed there has been an increase in nurse density per 1,000 population. The United Kingdom is the only country where there was a decrease in nurse density over the time period reviewed, with a drop from 9.0 nurses per 1,000 in 2000 to 7.9 nurses per 1,000 people in 2015. The United Kingdom was also below the OECD average in 2012 by 2.4 nurses per 1,000.

Updated January 2017.
